> Well, I've already managed to login successfully on several hosts
> using HTML form credentials, but lately I've been getting some
> InvalidAttributeValueException like if my inputs were all left blank.
Is there a reproducible sequence of events that lead to your getting 
below exception?  Is it with HEAD of heritrix or a released version?  
Sounds like a bug with our persisting fields out of the UI (Someone 
recently reported to the sourceforge Bugs list a simliar issue where we 
don't persist if UI is not in expert mode?).

...
>
>
> About that other issue (rerunning the login). Some inputs are
> generated by the server based on my IP and God knows what...thats why
> I wanted to retry the post. Apparently thats not possible right?
> (6.2.3.2.4. Known Limitations
Is it that the form inputs differ by 'god knows what' every time you 
run?  Thats annoying.  So, how do you handle it?  You notice 
failure-to-login in log, then change form inputs in UI?  And then, after 
changing the form inputs, you want to retry the page -- but the page 
does not get retried because the page has already been crawled? 

Have you tried force fetching the URL? (Force fetching is available in a 
paused crawler. See toward bottom of the screen, the 'View or Edit 
Frontier URIs <http://localhost:8080/console/frontier.jsp>' link). Force 
fetching may work.  But it might not because we keep the credential 
state in the server object.  The old state may block the rerunning of 
the credentials.  I haven't tried it (Otherwise, need to add to UI and 
JMX a way to clear any stored server credentials).

St.Ack
